lead_paragraph: In interviews, supporters of Mr. Trump expressed concern about terrorists coming across the border, while Mr. Sanders’s backers were anxious about the growing inequality in wealth and income.

byline.contributor: Megan Thee-Brenan contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: They’re Mad and Sure Their Guy Is the One to Lead the Fight
headline.main: Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump Voters Share Anger, but Direct It Differently

snippet: In interviews, supporters of Mr. Trump expressed concern about terrorists coming across the border, while Mr. Sanders’s backers were anxious about the growing inequality in wealth and income.
abstract: Iowan supporters of Donald J Trump and Sen Bernie Sanders share sense of disempowerment, anger at American political system and conviction that only their candidate is capable of fixing it; groups, who skew white and male and equal one another in passion, stand to influence course of 2016 presidential election.
